summary: The "audiovisual communications policy" within the EU framework encompasses regulations governing the broadcasting and distribution of multimedia content. This policy aims to ensure that audiences across Europe enjoy diverse and high-quality broadcasts, including sports tournaments like the UEFA Champions League and the IIHF hockey finals. It emphasizes the importance of subtitling and accessibility for elite athletes and sportsmen, enhancing their visibility during championships. The policy also serves as a catalyst for innovation among broadcasters, promoting benchmarking practices that align with evolving standards. By fostering a competitive environment, the policy supports the growth of the audiovisual sector, ultimately benefiting consumers and stakeholders alike.
